message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Vote: constitutive character → shortened to character">
The author proposes: introduce "constitutive character (德 De)" at first occurrence with a TN that explicitly tells the reader it will be shortened to "character" in the following paragraphs. Then use plain "character" throughout the rest of the text.

This gives:
- Precision at introduction (constitutive character)
- Lightweight running text (character)
- Reader is explicitly told about the shortening, so no confusion

YES or NO? Brief response.
</teammate-message>

input.content: **YES.** The explicit shortening notice resolves my ambiguity concern -- once the reader has been told that "character" means "constitutive character" in this context, the bare word carries the right meaning without the weight. Clean solution.

routing.content: **YES.** The explicit shortening notice resolves my ambiguity concern -- once the reader has been told that "character" means "constitutive character" in this context, the bare word carries the right meaning without the weight. Clean solution.
